survey.title: MIA Community Census Initial Survey
survey.description: This is the first survey of the MIA community census!

sections.title: Basic Information
sections.description: This section is simply for us to identify who is filling out the survey.

questions.label: Native language(s)
questions.question: Select your native language(s) (Select all that apply)

questions.label: Age
questions.question: Age

questions.label: Sex
questions.question: Select your sex

questions.label: Country of birth
questions.question: What is your country of birth?

questions.label: Country of Residence
questions.question: What country do you currently live in?

questions.label: Field of Occupation
questions.question: What is your general field of occupation?

questions.label: Hours of Work In a Week
questions.note: If you are not employed, select '0'
questions.question: How many hours a week do you work?

questions.label: Current Level of Education
questions.note: If you are not a student, simply select 'None'
questions.question: If you are a student, what level of education are you currently taking?

questions.label: Languages learned to fluency
questions.question: Select the language(s) that you have learned to fluency
questions.note: By fluency, we are referring to around a B2 level in the European framework based on the following chart: https://www.coe.int/en/web/common-european-framework-reference-languages/table-1-cefr-3.3-common-reference-levels-global-scale

questions.label: Languages You Actively Studied But Did Not Reach B2
questions.question: Select the languages you have studied before (and/or are currently studying) but did not reach a B2 level in

questions.label: Languages You Actively Study
questions.question: Select the target languages that you are currently actively studying (Select all that apply)

questions.label: Target Language That You Will Focus On For This Survey
questions.question: While we would like to ask the same questions for every target language you are actively studying, that would make the survey too long. Please select one target language of yours to focus on for the remainder of this survey.
questions.note: THIS IS A VERY IMPORTANT QUESTION! In following questions, when we ask about 'your target language', we are referring to the language you select for this question. If you are only actively studying one language, then simply select that language.

questions.label: Months Studying Target Language
questions.question: How many months have you been studying your target language (including before starting immersion-based/MIA-inspired study)

questions.label: Months Studying Target Language Using Immersion-based Learning
questions.question: How many months have you been studying your target language using immersion-based learning?

questions.label: Description of Studies in Target Language Before MIA
questions.question: Describe your studies in your target language before immersion-based learning?
questions.note: Please include any relevant links or information about methods/sources you used

sections.title: Language Learning
sections.description: This section will help us understand your general attitude and goals with language learning

questions.label: Motivation For Learning Target Language
questions.question: What are your motivations for learning your target language? (Select all that apply)

questions.label: Biggest Problem when Studying a Foreign Language
questions.question: What is the biggest problem you have when studying a foreign language (in general)
questions.note: This question is not asking about a single target language in particular, such as Japanese, but rather is asking about language learning as a whole.

questions.label: Biggest Difficulty With Your Target Language (referring to JUST the one target language you selected a few questions ago)
questions.question: What is the most difficult part of learning your specific target language?

questions.label: Biggest Emotional Difficulty When Studying Target Language
questions.question: Please describe the biggest emotional hurdles you have come across while pursuing your target language

questions.label: Biggest Problem With Tools For Immersion Learning
questions.question: Please describe the biggest problem you have with the tools you use for immersion-based learning
questions.note: This question is trying to identify pain points people have with the tools that are commonly promoted for immersion-based learning

questions.label: Hours Spent Daily on Computer
questions.question: How many hours do you spend on a desktop computer each day?

questions.label: Hours Spent Daily on Smartphones
questions.question: How many hours do you spend on a smartphone each day?
questions.note: This question is trying to identify pain points people have with the tools that are commonly promoted for immersion-based learning

questions.label: Hours Spent Daily on Tablet
questions.question: How many hours do you spend on a tablet each day?
questions.note: This question is trying to identify pain points people have with the tools that are commonly promoted for immersion-based learning

questions.label: Learns pitch accent when learning words in Japanese
questions.question: Do you learn a word's pitch accent when learning words in Japanese? (If your target langauge is not Japanese, simply answer 'No')

questions.label: Resources Used to Study Kanji/Hanzi
questions.question: What resources did you use to study Kanji/Hanzi (Feel free to leave blank if your target language is neither Japanese nor Chinese)

questions.label: Hours Per Week Engaging With Language Learning Communities
questions.question: On average, how many hours per week do you spend engaging with language learning communities?
questions.note: By language learning communities, we are referring to things like the MIA Discord, language learning online forums, etc

questions.label: Feeling About Time Spent In Language Learning Communities
questions.question: How do you feel about the amount of time you spend in language learning communities? (1 - I spend nowhere near enough time  and I want to spend more time in them; 5 - I spend way too much time engaging in language learning communities)

questions.label: Time In Language Learning Communities Benefits Studies
questions.question: Do you feel that the time you spend in language learning communities benefits your language learning studies? (1 - very detrimental to my studies; 5 - very beneficial to my studies)

questions.label: Enjoys The Time Spent in Language Learning Communities
questions.question: Do you enjoy the time spent in language learning communities (1 - not at all; 5 - most definitely)

questions.label: Language Learning Communities You Engage With
questions.question: What language learning communities do you engage with?

questions.label: MIA Helps Achieve Language Learning Goals
questions.question: Do you feel that MIA helps in your language learning pursuits? (via addons, YouTube, etc) (1 - not helpful at all; 5 very helpful)

questions.label: Feedback on What MIA Does Well
questions.question: Do you have feedback on what MIA does exceptionally well?

questions.label: Feedback on What MIA Does Poorly
questions.question: Do you have feedback on what MIA does poorly?

questions.label: Ideal Direction for MIA
questions.question: In your eyes, what is the ideal direction for MIA?
questions.note: This question is for us to better understand what people would like to see from MIA in the future.
